metadata.target_role: Director of Engineering, Data Science & Engineering
metadata.notes: Nonprofit political tech. Gaps: no 20+ person org leadership, no full production ML/AI systems at scale, no political/electoral background. Bridging: emphasize production model deployment (Paradigm), data lake and governance builds, cross-functional leadership, and mission-driven culture fit.

header.name: Matt Oremland, PhD
header.target_title: Director of Engineering, Data Science & Engineering

summary: Data science and engineering leader with 10+ years of experience building analytics organizations, data infrastructure, and production modeling systems from the ground up. Proven track record of designing and deploying end-to-end data pipelines, establishing governance frameworks, and leading cross-functional teams to deliver data-driven capabilities that directly impact business outcomes. Experienced in partnering with senior leadership to define data strategy, foster data-centric cultures, and translate complex analytical work into products and insights that power organizational decision-making.

Designed and built end-to-end data pipelines and risk-scoring models from scratch using Python and Snowflake - from raw data ingestion and quality remediation through transformation, modeling, and operationalization into production systems

Designed a reference data architecture to consolidate and harmonize data from multiple external sources into a unified internal framework, establishing governance standards for consistency, quality, and accessibility across the organization
Built reusable Python tooling to standardize analytics workflows, reducing manual effort and enabling scalable, consistent data products across the organization

experience.title: Consulting Data Scientist

Built a consumer-facing daily puzzle game entirely from scratch as a solo full-stack project: Python for puzzle generation, React/Node.js/Vite/Tailwind for the frontend, Google OAuth for authentication, and Supabase for backend data management - running daily with active users for 2+ months

Partnered directly with client engineering teams and VP-level stakeholders to translate business needs into data solutions, navigating ambiguous requirements and delivering in fast-moving environments

experience.title: Director, Data & Analytics (Medical Affairs)
bullets: Defined and executed enterprise data strategy, aligning analytics capabilities with organizational objectives and serving as strategic advisor to senior leadership on data-driven decision-making

Implemented predictive modeling programs using machine learning to inform operational decisions, selecting modeling approaches based on business need and data maturity
Led executive-level reporting sessions, translating complex analytical findings into clear business context and actionable recommendations for senior leadership

Mentored junior analysts, set technical standards for data workflows, and contributed to a team culture of analytical rigor and continuous improvement
Promoted from Data Scientist to Senior Data Scientist based on expanded technical leadership and contributions to data infrastructure

cover_letter.opening: I am writing to express my interest in the Director of Engineering role leading ActBlue's Data Science & Engineering department. The opportunity to build and scale the data infrastructure, teams, and culture that power a mission-driven organization - translating data into a strategic advantage at a moment when grassroots civic engagement has never mattered more - is exactly the kind of work I want to be doing.
body: My background is built on doing the core work this role requires: taking data functions from fragmented, ad hoc states and transforming them into trusted, scalable, organization-wide capabilities. At Gilead Sciences, I built a centralized data lake from scratch, established the governance and ownership frameworks that made data trustworthy across the organization, and hired and developed the analytics team. At Redica Systems, I designed a unified data architecture to harmonize data from multiple external sources and built production risk-scoring models end-to-end. Through my consulting practice, I have deployed production ML models with ongoing feature engineering, monitoring, and retraining - the full lifecycle that ActBlue's ML infrastructure needs to support. Across all of these roles, I have partnered closely with engineering on infrastructure decisions, driven data adoption with non-technical stakeholders, and ensured that data capabilities directly served business outcomes rather than existing in isolation.

I am drawn to ActBlue's mission and the operational intensity it demands. The deadline-driven nature of political fundraising - where data systems need to be reliable, responsive, and scalable precisely when stakes are highest - mirrors the kind of high-pressure, high-impact environments I have thrived in. I understand what it means to build systems that others depend on, and I understand what it means to lead teams through moments where the work genuinely matters. I would welcome the opportunity to discuss how my experience in data engineering leadership, production ML systems, and enterprise data transformation can contribute to ActBlue's next phase of growth.
cover_letter.closing: Thank you for your time and consideration. I look forward to the possibility of continuing this conversation.
